content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Ore Mining and Processing at Position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-15.0, y=-50.0) for mining iron ore.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-16.5, y=-51.5) intended to collect mined iron ore.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-15.5, y=-53.5) to move items, currently waiting for source items.
- Transport Belt group connecting various entities, including belts from (x=-16.5, y=-54.5) to (x=-14.5, y=-54.5).

### Iron Ore Processing at Position (-10.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-10.0, y=-50.0) for smelting iron ore, currently out of fuel and lacking ingredients.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-9.5, y=-48.5) to move items, currently out of fuel.

### Storage
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-14.5, y=-48.5) for storing items.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors in Finding Suitable Positions for Wooden Chests
- Ensure there is enough space and no obstructions when attempting to place a wooden chest.

### Iron Ore Not Reaching the Chest
- Verify the transport belt connections and ensure there are no blockages preventing iron ore from reaching the chest.

### No Iron Ore Available for the Furnace
- Check the supply chain from mining to the furnace to ensure iron ore is being transported correctly.

### Inserter Fuel Management
- Regularly check and refuel inserters to prevent them from running out of fuel and stopping operations.

### Output Blocked by Item on the Ground
- Ensure there is a sink entity or storage available to accept outputs from mining drills to prevent blockages.

### Inserting Items Without Inventory
- Before attempting to insert items, ensure that the required items are available in your inventory to avoid insertion errors.
